ICC member states seek to calm US concerns
subhed: Gathered for their annual assembly in The Hague, the 125 member states of the International Criminal Court opted not to confront Washington, which has threatened the Court's officials with sweeping sanctions unless the arrest warrant for Benjamin Netanyahu is withdrawn.

France opts for discretion after drones spotted above naval base
byline: By Chloé Hoorman and Elise Vincent
subhed: While other European countries have chosen to politicize suspicious flyovers of strategic infrastructure, France has remained cautious about attributing responsibility for these intrusions.

title: 17 found dead in migrant vessel off the island of Crete
subhed: Two survivors who were saved from the drifting vessel said that following bad weather, the migrants had no way to cover up, nor to eat or drink anything. Over the past year, an increasing number of migrants have headed to the Greek island of Crete as a way of reaching EU territory from Libya.

title: 'Notre-Dame de Paris's triumph highlights the Church's uncharitable position in refusing to charge tourists'
subhed: Not charging the millions of visitors who flock to the Paris cathedral each year is incomprehensible when considering the dire state of public finances devoted to the conservation of France's religious heritage, writes Le Monde's Michel Guerrin in his column.

title: 2026 World Cup excites Atlanta's business community: 'A generational opportunity'
subhed: The capital of Georgia, which hosted the 1996 Olympic Games, is set to welcome eight matches during the upcoming World Cup. For local business leaders, the event is first and foremost an opportunity to do business.

Influential study on glyphosate safety retracted 25 years after publication
subhed: A 2000 study that concluded the well-known herbicide glyphosate was safe, widely cited since then, has just been officially disavowed by the journal that published it. The scientists are suspected of having signed a text actually prepared by Monsanto.

title: War in Ukraine: Europe finds itself sidelined and humiliated by the Trump administration
byline: By Elsa Conesa (Berlin (Germany), correspondent), Claire Gatinois and Philippe Jacqué (Brussels, Europe bureau)
subhed: Steve Witkoff, the US president's special envoy, and Jared Kushner, Donald Trump's son-in-law, chose to meet the Ukrainian negotiators in Miami after canceling their Brussels stopover on their return from Moscow.

title: Zelensky without Yermak: The story of a split at the top of Ukraine
byline: By Ariane Chemin (Kyiv (Ukraine), special correspondent) and Thomas d’Istria (Kyiv (Ukraine), correspondent)
subhed: As Ukraine negotiates an end to the war, Volodymyr Zelensky had to part ways with his chief diplomat, Andriy Yermak, a political lightning rod and a close friend. The Ukrainian president is doing everything to downplay the departure of his right-hand man.
